title: Barcelona wonderkid Ansu Fati left out of Spain's Under 17 World Cup squad
text:
Ansu Fati has not been called up by Spain for the Under 17 World Cup later this month.

The Barcelona starlet had been expected to be selected for the tournament, making him miss up to five weeks of action.

Fati was born in Guinea Bissau and is also qualified to represent Portugal at international level.

Ansu Fati has not been called up by Spain for the Under 17 World Cup later this month

'We have taken the decision not to include him in this squad,' Spain's youth team sporting director Francisco Hernandez explained on Wednesday.

'This was following a wider sporting review in that we consider him in a better position to play with an older category and for that to be the case, he cannot come to the Under-17 World Cup.

'We want him to star for the senior team as soon as possible.'

The 16-year-old sensation burst onto the scene at the start of this season, becoming Barcelona's youngest ever goalscorer in a 2-2 draw at Osasuna.

This year's tournament starts on October 26 in Brazil.
description: The 16-year-old Barcelona sensation had been expected to be selected for the tournament, making him miss up to five weeks of action.
